page.title: 3.3.0: Lesson Overview
page.contents:
In this lesson, you will assess the fit of a function by plotting and analyzing residuals.

When you finish this lesson, you will be able to:

  • Plot and calculate residuals for a data set and use the information to judge whether a linear model is a good fit.

Here are the activities that will help you reach those goals:

  • 3.3.1: Subtracting an Estimated Value from an Actual Value
  • 3.3.2: Plotting and Analyzing Residuals
  • 3.3.2: Self Check
  • 3.3.3: Matching Residuals Graphs to Scatter Plots
  • 3.3.3: Self Check
  • 3.3.4: Identifying Best Fit Line for Residuals on a Graph

After that, you’ll practice and review.

  • 3.3.5: Practice
  • 3.3.6: Lesson Summary

page.title: 3.3.1: Subtracting an Estimated Value from an Actual Value
page.contents:
Warm Up Activity

Mentally calculate how close the estimate is to the actual value using the difference: 

actual value − estimated value.

  1. Actual value: 24.8 grams. Estimated value: 19.6 grams
  2. Actual value: $112.11. Estimated value: $109.30
  3. Actual value: 41.5 centimeters. Estimated value: 45.90 centimeters
  4. Actual value: \(-1.34\) degrees Celsius. Estimated value: \(-2.45\) degrees Celsius

Enter your answer here:

Check your answers:

  1. 5.2 grams
  2. $2.81
  3. \(-4.4\) centimeters
  4. 1.11 degrees Celsius

page.title: 3.3.2: Plotting and Analyzing Residuals
page.contents:
Activity

 

1. Here is the data table for orange weights from a previous lesson. Use technology to find the scatter plot and a line of best fit.

number of oranges

weight in kilograms

3

1.027

4

1.162

5

1.502

6

1.617

7

1.761

8

2.115

9

2.233

10

2.569

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

The equation of the best fit line is \(y=0.216x+0.345\).


2. What level of accuracy makes sense for the slope and intercept values? Explain your reasoning.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

Rounding the values to the thousandths place makes sense because that would be to an accuracy of 1 gram, which is what the original data used.


3. What does the linear model estimate for the weight of the box of oranges for each of the numbers of oranges?

Enter your answer here:

Check your answer:

0.216 kg for each orange


4. Compare the weight of the box with 3 oranges in it to the estimated weight of the box with 3 oranges in it. Explain or show your reasoning.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

The actual weight is 1.027 kg, and the estimated weight is 0.993 kg. Therefore, the actual weight is 0.034 kg greater than the estimate.


5. How many oranges are in the box when the linear model estimates the weight best? Explain or show your reasoning.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

6 oranges are in the box when the estimate is best. The difference between the estimated weight and the actual weight is only 0.023 kg, while the other points are farther from the line.


6. How many oranges are in the box when the linear model estimates the weight least well? Explain or show your reasoning.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

7 oranges are in the box when the estimate is worst. The difference between the estimated weight and the actual weight is 0.095, which is the most of any of the values.


7. The difference between the actual value and the value estimated by a linear model is called the residual. 

  • If the actual value is greater than the estimated value, the residual is positive. 
  • If the actual value is less than the estimated value, the residual is negative.
    1. For the orange weight data set, what is the residual for the line of best fit when there are 3 oranges? 
    2. On the same axes as the scatter plot, plot this residual at the point where \(x=3\) and \(y\) has the value of the residual.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

The residual is \(0.034 (1.027−0.993=0.034)\).

 

 

8. Find the residuals for each of the other points in the scatter plot and graph them.

 

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to check your work.

Compare your answer:


9. Which point on the scatter plot has the residual closest to zero? What does this mean about the weight of the box with that many oranges in it?

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

6 oranges. It means the estimated weight of the box with 6 oranges in it is closest to the actual value.


10. How can you use the residuals to decide how well a line fits the data?

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

A line will result in more accurate estimates when the residuals are closer to zero.

 

Video: Finding Residuals

Watch the following video to learn more about finding residuals.

page.title: 3.3.2: Self Check
page.contents: The equation for a line of best fit is \(y = 2.2x +3.4\). Find the residual for the point \((3, 9)\).

answer.response: Incorrect. Let’s try again a different way: Be sure to add the constant when evaluating the line of best fit at \(x = 3\). Then find the actual \(y\)-value – estimated \(y\)-value. The answer is \(-1\).
Incorrect. Let’s try again a different way: To find the residual, subtract the actual value – estimated value. Watch the order of the values and the signs when subtracting. The answer is \(-1\).
That’s correct! Check yourself. Substitute \(x =3\) so that \(y=2.2(3)+3.4= 10\). This is the estimated value. The actual value at \(x=3\) is 9, so \(9-10 =-1\).
Incorrect. Let’s try again a different way. Substitute 3 in for \(x\), not 9, in the equation. The answer is \(-1\).

answer.answer_text: I am not sure.

page.title: 3.3.2: Additional Resources
page.contents:
Finding Residuals

The gestation time for an animal is the typical duration between conception and birth. The longevity of an animal is the typical lifespan for that animal. The gestation times, in days, and longevities, in years, for 13 types of animals are shown in the table below. 

Animal

Gestation Time (days)

Longevity (years)

Baboon

187

20

Black Bear

219

18

Beaver

105

5

Bison

285

15

Cat

63

12

Chimpanzee

23

20

Cow

284

15

Dog

61

12

Fox (Red)

52

7

Goat

151

8

Lion

100

15

Sheep

154

12

Wolf

63

5


The equation of a line of best fit is \(y = 6.642 + 0.03974x\), where \(x\) represents the gestational time, in days, and \(y\) represents longevity, in years. 


A lion’s gestation time is 100 days, and its longevity is 15 years. What does this line of best fit predict the lion’s longevity to be?

\(y=6.642+0.03974 (100)=10.6\)

The residual would be the actual value – estimated value or \(15-10.6 = 4.4\).

The residual value is 4.4.

Try It: Finding Residuals

In the table above, a dog has a gestation time of 61 days and a longevity of 12 years.

Using the same equation, \(y = 6.642 + 0.03974x\), what would the residual value be?

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to check your work.

Here is how to find the residual:

Substitute \(x =61\) into the equation, \(y = 6.642+0.03974(61)=9.06614\).

So, the residual is the (actual value – estimated value):

\(12-9.06614=2.93386\).

How did you do? Know that you learn more from wrong answers than from right answers! Wrong answers help us find flaws in our thinking. Take a minute to think about why you got the question wrong. Then you won’t get this type of question wrong again!

answer.answer_text: I’d like to retry the self check.
I’m ready for the next activity.

page.title: 3.3.3: Matching Residuals Graphs to Scatter Plots
page.contents:
Activity


1. Match the scatter plots and given linear models to the graph of the residuals.

Enter your answer here:

Check your answer:

  • A matches with K
  • B matches with G
  • C matches with L
  • D matches with H
  • E matches with J
  • F matches with I


2. Turn over the scatter plots so that only the residuals are visible. Based on the residuals, which line would produce the most accurate estimates? Which line fits its data worst?

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answers:

B fits its data the best. C or E fits its data the worst.




What Do Residual Plots Tell Us?

Residuals tell us how close to accurate a line of best fit really is.

Ideally, the residual from a line of best fit will be scattered randomly above and below the horizontal line of 0 on the residual plot. The residual plot would have points above and below the horizontal line of 0. This shows that the relationship between the two variables in the data set can be approximated by a linear model. 

When the residuals are on 0, this indicates that the line of best fit goes through those points.

A curved pattern shows that a nonlinear model would be better to describe the relationships between points. 



Extending Your Thinking

  1. Tyler estimates a line of best fit for some linear data about the mass, in grams, of different numbers of apples. Here is the graph of the residuals.

  1. What does Tyler’s line of best fit look like according to the graph of the residuals?
  2.  How well does Tyler’s line of best fit model the data? Explain your reasoning.


Enter your answers here:

Check your answers:

  1. The data are between 10 and 30 grams above the line of best fit.
  2. Tyler’s line does not model the data well because all of the residuals are positive.

Extending Your Thinking

  1. Lin estimates a line of best fit for the same data. The graph shows the residuals.

  1. What does Lin’s line of best fit look like in comparison to the data?
  2. How well does Lin’s line of best fit model the data? Explain your reasoning.


Enter your answers here:

Check your answers:

  1. The line is below the lower half of the data and above the second half of the data.
  2. It is not a good fit because the first several residuals are all positive and the last several residuals are negative. They should not have a pattern if the line of best fit is good.

Extending Your Thinking

  1. Kiran also estimates a line of best fit for the same data. The graph shows the residuals.

  1. What does Kiran’s line of best fit look like in comparison to the data?
  2. How well does Kiran’s line of best fit model the data? Explain your reasoning.


Enter your answers here:

Check your answers:

  1. Kiran’s line appears to go through the middle of the data with some points above and some points below the line.
  2. Kiran’s line of best fit is a good one because it appears to pass through the middle of the data.
  1. Who has the best estimate of the line of best fit: Tyler, Lin, or Kiran? Explain your reasoning.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

Kiran’s line of best fit is the best because the graph of the residuals lets me know that some points are above the line of best fit and some are below. In addition, two of the residuals are close to 0, so that indicates that the line passes through or near those 2 points. Tylers line of best fit is not a good one because it is above all the data. Lin’s line of best fit is below all the lower data values and above all the high data values, so it is not a good fit.

page.title: 3.3.3: Self Check
page.contents: Which residual plot shows the most accurate line of best fit for a scatter plot?

answer.response: Incorrect. Let’s try again a different way: The residual shows a good line of best fit if the points are scattered above and below the horizontal line of 0 without a pattern or curve. The answer is
Incorrect. Let’s try again a different way: The residual shows a good line of best fit if the points are scattered above and below the horizontal line of 0 without a pattern or curve. The answer is
That’s correct! Check yourself: The points in the residual are scattered randomly above and below the horizontal line that is 0. There is no curve or pattern.
Incorrect. Let’s try again a different way: The residual shows a good line of best fit if the points are scattered above and below the horizontal line of 0 without a pattern or curve. The answer is

answer.answer_text: I am not sure.

page.title: 3.3.3: Additional Resources
page.contents:
The Meaning of Residuals

Suppose that you have a scatter plot and that you have drawn the line of best fit on your plot. Remember that the residual for a point in the scatter plot is the vertical distance of that point from the line of best fit. In the previous lesson, you looked at a scatter plot showing how fuel efficiency was related to curb weight for five compact cars. The scatter plot and line of best fit are shown below.


Consider the following questions:  

  1. What kind of residual does Point A have?
    Point A has a large positive residual.  
  2. What kind of residual does Point B have?
    Point B has a small positive residual.  
  3. What kind of residual does Point C have?
    Point C has a very large negative residual.


Try It: The Meaning of Residuals

Suppose you are given a scatter plot and a line of best fit that looks like this:



Describe what you think the residual plot would look like.

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to check your work.

Here is how to sketch the residual plot:

Moving from left to right, the points initially tend to be below the line of best fit, then move above it, and then below it. The residuals are negative, then positive, and then negative again. This means that the points in the residual plot will be below the horizontal axis, then above it, and then below it again. 

The residual plot has an arch shape like this:


How did you do? Know that you learn more from wrong answers than from right answers! Wrong answers help us find flaws in our thinking. Take a minute to think about why you got the question wrong. Then you won’t get this type of question wrong again!

answer.answer_text: I’d like to retry the self check.
I’m ready for the next activity.

page.title: 3.3.4: Identifying Best Fit Line for Residuals on a Graph
page.contents:
Cool Down Activity

Each of these graphs of residuals is from the same set of data using different lines to fit the data. Which graph is most likely to represent the residuals from the best fit line? Explain your reasoning.

A

B

C

D


Enter your answer here:

Compare your answer:

Graph A is most likely to represent the residuals from the best fit line. The residuals seem well spaced on either side of the \(x\)-axis without an obvious pattern, and all of the residuals are close to 0.

page.title: 3.3.5: Practice
page.contents:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

1. A line of best fit for a data set is \(y=1.1x+3.4\). Find the residual for each of the coordinate pairs, \((x,y)\).

  1. \((5,8.8)\)

Correct! \(-0.1\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(-0.1\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \((2.5,5.95)\)

Correct! \(-0.2\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(-0.2\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \((0,3.72)\)

Correct! 0.32

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 0.32. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \((1.5,5.05)\)

Correct!  0

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 0. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \((-3,0)\)

Correct! \(-0.1\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(-0.1\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \((-5,-4.86)\)

Correct! \(-2.76\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(-2.76\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

2. In the scatter plot below, the length of fish and the age of the fish are shown. The residual for the fish that is 2 years old and 100 mm long is 8.06 mm.

What does this residual mean?

Correct! The actual fish at 2 years old is about 8 mm longer than the linear model estimates.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 3.3.2–3.3.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is: The actual fish at 2 years old is about 8 mm longer than the linear model estimates. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

3. Four athletes on a track team are comparing their personal bests in the 100-meter and 200-meter events. A table of their best times is shown below. 

Athlete

100 m time (seconds)

200 m time (seconds)

1

12.95

26.68

2

13.81

29.48

3

14.66

28.11

4

14.88

30.93

The line of best fit has an equation of \(y= 1.5115x + 7.526\), where \(x\) represents the 100-meter time and \(y\) represents the 200-meter time.

  1. What is the residual for athlete number 1?

Correct! \(-0.42\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is: \(-0.42\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. What is the residual for athlete number 2?

Correct! 1.08

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is: 1.08. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. What is the residual for athlete number 3?

Correct! \(-1.57\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is: \(-1.57\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. What is the residual for athlete number 4?

Correct! 0.91

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 3.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is: 0.91. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


4. The curb weight of a car is the weight of the car without luggage or passengers. The scatter plot below shows the curb weight, in pounds, of 5 cars and their fuel efficiency, in miles per gallon. 

Will the residual for 25.33 be a positive or negative value?

Correct! The residual is positive because it is above the line.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 3.3.3–3.3.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is: the residual is positive because it is above the line. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

page.title: 3.3.6: Lesson Summary
page.contents:
In this lesson, you learned how to:

  • Plot and calculate residuals for a data set and use the information to judge whether a linear model is a good fit.

Here are the activities that helped you reach those goals:

  • 3.3.1: Subtracting an Estimated Value from an Actual Value
    • In this activity, you discussed strategies and understandings you had for subtracting an estimated value from an actual value. This discussion helped you develop fluency and helped prepare you to compute residuals from a linear model.
  • 3.3.2: Plotting and Analyzing Residuals
    • In this activity, you explored the concept of residuals, plotted residuals, and analyzed the residuals to informally assess the fit of a function. In this activity, you also fitted a function to data and used the function to solve problems. You learned that a residual is the difference between the actual \(y\)-value for a point and the expected \(y\)-value for the point on the linear model with the same associated \(x\)-value.
  • 3.3.2: Self Check 
  • 3.3.3: Matching Residuals Graphs to Scatter Plots
    • In this activity, you took turns with a partner, matching graphs of residuals to scatter plots that displayed linear models. You explained your thinking and listened in order to explain your reasoning and critique the reasoning of others. You recognized that a plot of the residuals for data that are fit well by a linear model shows residuals that are close to the \(x\)-axis and do not show a noticeable pattern.
  • 3.3.3: Self Check 
  • 3.3.4: Identifying Best Fit Line for Residuals on a Graph
    • In this activity, you identified a graph most likely to represent the residuals from the best fit line.

After these activities, you completed the following practice:

  • 3.3.5: Practice

Checking In 

On a scale of 1 to 5, how confident do you feel about the learning goals of this lesson?

Correct!

If you’ve answered 3 or less, be sure to reach out to your teacher before starting the next lesson.
